node.title: ACT records six new COVID-19 cases, confirms second Omicron infection
node.alt: A medical worker with a mask looks at some test tubes.
node.description: The ACT records six new COVID-19 cases as authorities confirm its second case of the Omicron variant. The ACT's first Omicron case has also been linked to a Sydney climbing gym.
node.content:
["The ACT has recorded six new COVID-19 cases as authorities confirm the territory's\u00a0second case of the Omicron variant.", "A close contact of the ACT's first Omicron case, the second case was included in yesterday's numbers.", "NSW Health has also found the ACT's first Omicron case, announced on Friday, likely acquired their infection at the Sydney Indoor Climbing Gym Villawood.", "There are six people in hospital with the virus in the ACT, including two people in intensive care. No patients require ventilation.", "There are currently 110 active cases of COVID-19 in the territory.", "On Saturday, the ACT\u00a0reached the milestone of 98 per cent of its population aged 12 and over being fully vaccinated.", "The ACT government announced changes yesterday to\u00a0quarantine requirements for close contacts of a confirmed Omicron case.", "Now, all close contacts of an Omicron case must quarantine for 14 days, regardless of their vaccination status.", "The\u00a0rule also applies to secondary contacts of a close contact, which is anyone living in the same home as a close contact of an Omicron case.", "The quarantine requirements have not changed for casual contact.", "
Parliament house closes\u00a0after\u00a0staffer tests positive to COVID-19
", "Meanwhile, parliament house in Canberra closed and Federal Greens leader Adam Bandt is isolating after one of his staff members tested positive for COVID-19.\u00a0", "A spokesperson for Mr Bandt said the staff member, who was in Canberra during the last sitting week of parliament, returned the positive result in Melbourne.\u00a0", "Health authorities in the ACT are now trying to determine if the staff member was infectious while he was in the capital.\u00a0", "Tasmanian Greens Senator Nick McKim is also isolating after being identified as a close contact.\u00a0", "", "
Why we hear about some COVID-19 variants more than others
"]
